body_html:
@DavidNorman actually we're in the process of creating a much simpler backend, based on the HLO evaluator -- the evaluator isn't 100% feature complete yet, but it will eventually be. Having the evaluator as an XLA backend could serve both has as an example for writing a new simple backend, and be useful for testing XLA and the evaluator itself. @kayzhu has more details.

We've been busy adding more features to the evaluator but hadn't started wrapping it in an actual backend yet. If you'd like to contribute, would you consider sending a PR that does that?

body:
@DavidNorman actually we're in the process of creating a much simpler backend, based on the [HLO evaluator](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/hlo_evaluator.h) -- the evaluator isn't 100% feature complete yet, but it will eventually be. Having the evaluator as an XLA backend could serve both has as an example for writing a new simple backend, and be useful for testing XLA and the evaluator itself. @kayzhu has more details.

We've been busy adding more features to the evaluator but hadn't started wrapping it in an actual backend yet. If you'd like to contribute, would you consider sending a PR that does that?
